{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3556616,"name":"Rosemarie","username":"Noname","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/58f4c7/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-13T23:19:03.266Z","cooked":"

Hello! i am relatively new to vision, and particularly this year it is really important to have accurate alignment. basically, we align on the reef using a profiled pid to get us to our desired position, and for the vision part, we are using photonvision.

we have a major issue though: for some reason, our robot is not constant in how it is positionned. Like around 1"-2" off.

Hereâ€™s what weâ€™ve noticed:

  • the estimated position of the robot is the (almost) same as our target, while the robot in real life is at the wrong place
  • we have a big offset with swerve-only position estimation, due to the carpet stretching/bumps/grip, but we correct it with vision
  • it is not constantly the same offset, which is what is the most bothering
  • our reef module is not perfect (at all), but technically that shouldnt be a major issue since the tags have absolute locations and if the robot only sees one it should estimate with that tag only

ideally, we would only have less than +/- 0.5" offset, since we use this both for autonomous mode and teleop. any hint/suggestion/idea/hypothesis as to why this happens is more than welcome.

also we have 3 limelights: one 3G and two 2+, all on the same side, all running photonvision.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2025-03-13T23:19:03.266Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":47,"reads":125,"readers_count":124,"score":260.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":495512,"topic_slug":"reef-auto-align-wit-pid-and-photonvision","display_username":"Rosemarie","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73723,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/reef-auto-align-wit-pid-and-photonvision/495512/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3556799,"name":"","username":"aspen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aspen/{size}/258678_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-14T05:11:23.554Z","cooked":"

hard to know for sure without seeing your code/field setup, but you say that you have 3 cameras but also are only relying on one reef tag - to me it seems like your other cameras might be seeing tags that are moving around on other field elements, which would throw off your pose. also, can i ask why all your cameras are on the same side? if you have multiple cameras, itâ€™s generally better to have them facing different ways to get greater coverage. if youâ€™re using advantagescope, you could also take a look at the pose created by each camera and see if those are inconsistent or jittering a lot

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2025-03-14T05:11:23.554Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":86,"readers_count":85,"score":22.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":495512,"topic_slug":"reef-auto-align-wit-pid-and-photonvision","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58585,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8033 | vice captain"},"post_url":"/t/reef-auto-align-wit-pid-and-photonvision/495512/2","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3556888,"name":"Rosemarie","username":"Noname","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/58f4c7/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-14T12:41:11.401Z","cooked":"

The cameras are on the same side because we heard having multiple looking at the same tag increases the accuracy, and from what weâ€™ve seen it slightly does, and usually we make the cameras only looks at one tag and block out the others, so that shouldnâ€™t be an issue I think?
